intro: Paepalanthus oblongus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are narrow and often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
